name: SALB
tagline: Frontend for speech synthesis using HTS voice models.
body:
# SALB

The SALB system is a frontend framework for speech synthesis using HMM based voice models built by [HTS][1].
See our Releases [here](https://github.com/m-toman/SALB/releases) and the github project page [here](https://github.com/m-toman/SALB).
Build instructions, license information and a generic readme are contained in the package.
Additional documentation can be found in the [project wiki](https://github.com/m-toman/SALB/wiki).


## Facts & features:
The SALB framework 
   - provides a frontend to [hts_engine][1] through SAPI5, a command-line-interface and a C++ API for embedding in other applications.
   - comes with an example [NSIS][2] script to aid building installer packages for distributing HTS voices as Microsoft Windows system voices.
   - incorporates [flite][3] for text processing of English.
   - supports other languages through the ability to load [Festival][4] format lexica and Letter-To-Sound rules (further preprocessing like number conversion can easily be added in C++).
   - compiles on MS Windows (>= Vista), Linux, Android, iOS.
   - includes a Visual Studio 2012 solution file for compiling the SAPI5 engine, CMake build files for everything else.
   - is released under liberal/MIT-like [license][5].

We also provide a free (Austrian) German voice model of a male, professional speaker, including number conversion, a pronunciation lexicon with 14k entries and a set of Letter-To-Sound rules.
Listen to some samples here: [Sample 1](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/m-toman/SALB/gh-pages/samples/sample1.wav), [Sample 2](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/m-toman/SALB/gh-pages/samples/sample2.wav), [Sample 3](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/m-toman/SALB/gh-pages/samples/sample3.wav)

## F.A.Q.

### How can I create a new voice model?
An easy way is to use the [HTS demo packages][1].
These produce htsvoice files that can be used with the SALB system.

### Why not use flite+hts_engine instead?
The SALB system is another layer on top of flite and hts_engine (see [Architecture](https://github.com/m-toman/SALB/blob/master/doc/architecture.svg)).
You might want this additional layer if:
- you want the SAPI5 interface.
- you would like to add a new language and/or use plain text Festival lexica and LTS rules*.
- you prefer the C++ interface.
- you would like to use the provided German voice model.

*Of course this is also possible in flite but a bit trickier. If you would really like to do that, take a look our description on adding a new language to flite [here](http://sourceforge.net/p/at-flite/wiki/AddingNewLanguage/).

### How can I contribute?
We would love to include language bindings (e.g. Python), further interfaces and more languages.
Of course, bug fixes, improvements etc. are also always welcome.


[1]: http://hts.sp.nitech.ac.jp/ "hts_engine"
[2]: http://nsis.sourceforge.net/ "NSIS"
[3]: http://www.festvox.org/flite/ "flite" 
[4]: http://www.cstr.ed.ac.uk/projects/festival/ "Festival"
[5]: https://github.com/m-toman/SALB/blob/master/COPYING "SALB license"
[6]: http://www.ftw.at/research-innovation/projects/salb?set_language=en "SALB project"
